issues.title: Missing Administrative Regulation for Implementation Procedures
issues.description: Federal law requires specific implementation procedures for drug and alcohol-free schools policies, including detailed disciplinary procedures, intervention programs, and notification requirements. While the Board Policy establishes the framework, an Administrative Regulation is needed to specify the "how" of implementation.

legal_citations.text: Requires local educational agencies to adopt and implement a policy to prevent the unlawful possession, use, or distribution of illicit drugs and alcohol by students and employees on school premises or as part of any school activities.

issues.required_language: Administrative procedures detailing: investigation protocols, progressive discipline procedures, referral processes to counseling/intervention programs, notification requirements to parents/guardians and law enforcement, and staff training requirements.

issues.title: Missing Specific Disciplinary Standards and Sanctions
issues.description: Federal law requires clear specification of disciplinary sanctions for violations. The policy only states students "may be subject to discipline" without detailing specific consequences or progressive discipline standards.

legal_citations.text: Standards of conduct that clearly prohibit, at a minimum, the unlawful possession, use, or distribution of illicit drugs and alcohol by students and employees on school premises or as part of any school activities.

issues.required_language: Clear statement of disciplinary sanctions that will be imposed on students and employees who violate the standards of conduct, including but not limited to: suspension, expulsion, referral to law enforcement, and mandatory participation in drug/alcohol abuse assistance or rehabilitation programs.

issues.title: Missing Health Risks and Legal Consequences Information
issues.description: Federal law requires the policy to include information about health risks associated with drug and alcohol use and legal sanctions under local, state, and federal law.

legal_citations.text: A description of the health risks associated with the use of illicit drugs and the abuse of alcohol; and a description of any drug or alcohol counseling, treatment, or rehabilitation or re-entry programs that are available.

issues.required_language: Description of health risks associated with illicit drug use and alcohol abuse, applicable legal sanctions under local, state and federal law, and available drug/alcohol counseling, treatment, rehabilitation and re-entry programs.

issues.title: Missing Annual Distribution and Notification Requirements
issues.description: Federal law requires annual distribution of policy information to all students and employees. The policy mentions communication but lacks specific annual distribution requirements and acknowledgment procedures.

legal_citations.text: A statement that compliance with the standards of conduct is mandatory and a description of disciplinary sanctions.

issues.required_language: Procedures for annual distribution of policy information to all students and employees, including acknowledgment requirements and documentation of receipt.

issues.title: Missing Reference to Tobacco Products
issues.description: While not federally required for drug-free schools compliance, California Education Code requires tobacco-free school policies, and it's common practice to include tobacco with drug and alcohol prohibitions for comprehensive substance-free policies.

legal_citations.text: Prohibits the use of tobacco products at school or school-sponsored activities.

issues.required_language: Tobacco products and electronic cigarettes/vaping devices should be included in the list of prohibited substances.
